titles: A pleasant commodie, of faire Em the Millers daughter of Manchester vvith the loue of William the Conqueror: As it was sundrietimes publiquely acted in the honourable citie of London, by the right honourable the Lord Strange his seruaunts.
author: Wilson, Robert, d. 1600, attributed name.
publisher: [By J. Danter] for T. N[ewman] and I. VV[innington] and are to be solde in S. Dunstones Churchyarde in Fleete-streete,
notes: Printer's and publishers' names from STC;  publication date estimated by STC.
Sometimes attributed to Robert Wilson; misattributed to William Shakespeare and to Robert Greene.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: William --  I, --  King of England, 1027 or 8-1087 --  Drama --  Early works to 1800.
